text: Suzanne Bergeron (June 23, 1930–November 19, 1998) was a Canadian abstract painter. ==Education== She studied painting under Jean Paul Lemieux at École des Beaux-Arts de Montréal, graduating in 1953. ==Collections== Her work is included in the collections of the Musée national des beaux-arts du Québec, the Art Gallery of Greater Victoria and the National Gallery of Canada ==References== Category:1930 births Category:1998 deaths Category:20th-century Canadian women artists Category:Abstract painters
title: Suzanne Bergeron
